These, Abdullah bin Mas'ud and Abdullah bin Umar, are more knowledgeable (Faqih) and learned than all those Companions from whom counting with pebbles was narrated. Likewise, Ibrahim Al-Nakha'i is more knowledgeable than Fatimah bint Al-Husayn, may Allah be pleased with them. With the great difference, which is that from these denial of counting is established, and from those counting is not established!
We can join to the two 'Abd's (Ibn Mas'ud and Ibn Umar) the lady Aisha, may Allah be pleased with them, but upon the Sheikh's method of arguing with what is not established! Ibn Abi Shaybah extracted in 'Al-Musannaf' from a woman of Banu Kulayb who said: 'Aisha saw me glorifying with Tasbihs (beads) I had. She said: Where are the witnesses?! Meaning the fingers.'
But God forbid that we argue with what is not authentic to us, even if others permitted that! With knowledge or ignorance! For this woman from Banu Kulayb I did not know.
From these authentic traditions, the error of what the Sheikh quoted following those flimsy traditions becomes clear to the noble readers:

book_title: Refutation of the 'Intensive Commentary' of Sheikh Abdullah Al-Habashi
text:
"'And prohibition of the permissibility of counting Dhikr with the Subha has not been reported from anyone of the Salaf nor the Khalaf...'.
For it is self-evident to everyone that whoever denies counting with pebbles denies counting with the Subha as well, because they are equal according to the Sheikh and others. According to us, denying it is more appropriate, because in the Subha are evils not found in counting with pebbles, as preceded pointing to that.
As for what they quoted from Ibn Hajar - who is Al-Haythami the Jurist, not Al-Asqalani the Muhaddith, contrary to what they insinuated! - 'That the previous Hadith of Sa'd is a correct basis for permitting the Subha.'
I say: Prove the throne then engrave! We have proven previously the weakness of the chain of Sa'd's Hadith as well as Safiyyah's Hadith. Even if the Hadith were established, it is not correct in our view to take the Subha as a basis because it is from the slogans of the Christians. We still see them until today hanging them on their waists with the cross on them. Added to that is that it is often a tool for showing off, reputation, and pretending righteousness and piety, like the one who hangs it on his neck, or winds it on his hand. As I said in the first treatise of 'Tasdid al-Isabah ila man Za'ama Nusrat al-Khulafa' al-Rashidin wa al-Sahabah' (1).
Then they said, following others: 'Using the Subha in large numbers of Dhikr where being occupied with it [counting] distracts from directing oneself to the Dhikr is better than counting with fingertips.'
foot_note: 1. (1) This is a new book of ours which we were compelled to author to refute the fabrications and errors of a group who colluded to author a treatise against us called 'Al-Isabah fi Nusrat al-Khulafa' al-Rashidin wa al-Sahabah'. Among the participants in authoring it was the virtuous Sheikh Al-Habashi! Our book consists of six treatises, of which three have been issued so far: The first in clarifying their fabrications and errors, the second in 'Salat al-Tarawih' which is a book collecting - or almost - what appeared in the Sunnah related to this prayer in the size of our book 'The Prophet's Prayer Described', and the third in 'Eid Prayer in the Musalla is the Sunnah'.

book_title: Refutation of the 'Intensive Commentary' of Sheikh Abdullah Al-Habashi
text:
I say: There is no large number in the Sunnah where being occupied with counting it distracts from directing oneself to the Dhikr! What drives the Sheikh and his likes to this claim, i.e., preferring the Subha in large numbers, is their adherence to what was not reported in the Sunnah of large numbers, like the adherence of some of them to the famous number in some formulas of innovated prayers! That is as previously alerted to.
I believe that being occupied with counting the Dhikr whose counting and enumeration is legitimate is a matter intended by the Wise Lawgiver just like the Dhikr itself. Were it not so, being occupied with counting would be futile, and this is something the Wise Sharia is above. Accordingly, it is not permissible for a rational Muslim to consider being occupied with counting the legitimate Dhikr, whatever its number, by the legitimate means as distracting from directing oneself to the Dhikr, because counting itself is a legitimate act of worship at the same time. What drives saying the contrary to this is adherence to invented numbers that cannot be enumerated except by an innovated means!
O Allah, make us among the supporters of Your Prophet's Sunnah, warriors against what people invented in Your religion.
* * *
Scarcely had the first and second articles of this blessed refutation, Allah willing, been published when the virtuous Sheikh Al-Habashi came out upon us with another response in another treatise with more talk than the first! He named it 'Nusrat al-Ta'aqub al-Hathith' (Support of the Intensive Commentary)! I had pointed to it more than once in the folds of our verification in some previous articles. When I saw it like its predecessor in misunderstanding my speech, fallacy in research, and exiting the proper path in debating with what is better; indeed, I found it more excessive than the first in attacking, insulting, and fabricating, which scholars rise above no matter how their views differ. Reflect for example on his saying regarding my person in the footnote (p. 3): 'He misguides Sheikh Badr al-Din in his using the Subha'!

book_title: Refutation of the 'Intensive Commentary' of Sheikh Abdullah Al-Habashi
text:
This is pure lie and mere fabrication. Would that he sufficed with this, but he followed it with his saying: 'And how can Nasir catch up with the dust of Sheikh Badr al-Din's sandal, may Allah have mercy on him, in knowledge and action...!' And his saying (p. 64): 'O his shame on that Day and O his scandal! This is if he dies a Muslim, otherwise he will be punished, and refuge is sought in Allah, with a bad ending'!
When I saw this and other things, I became certain that the Sheikh - may Allah forgive us and him - does not deserve being replied to. Time is too tight and precious to be spent in clarifying his ignorances and errors which almost never end!
In conclusion, I say: Despite all this that the Sheikh did, I hold him in utmost respect and veneration; because I think righteousness in him which is often exploited by some biased people for other than the righteous person's benefit if he were alert to that! Therefore, I initiate greeting him whenever I meet him, even though he, in responding - returning the greeting of course! - almost does not appear either!
I ask Allah, the Blessed and Exalted, to grant us and him success to follow His Book, track the traces of His Prophet, and avoid what the innovators invented in his religion. Indeed, He is Hearing and Responsive.
Glory be to You O Allah and with Your praise, I testify that there is no god but You, I seek Your forgiveness and repent to You. And may Allah send blessings upon our Master Muhammad the Unlettered Prophet and upon his family and companions and send peace. And praise be to Allah, Lord of the Worlds.
